H0.text: Electrical force is the non‑contact force of Earth that keeps the Moon in orbit.

H1.text: Magnetic force is the non‑contact force of Earth that keeps the Moon in orbit around Earth.

H2.text: Centripetal force is the force of Earth that keeps the Moon in orbit around the Earth, causing the Moon to revolve due to a non‑contact force.

H3.text: Gravitational force is the non‑contact force from Earth that keeps the Moon in orbit around the planet.

A4.text: The gravity of the Earth on the Moon is the same as the gravity of the Earth on an apple:

A5.text: Gravity becomes the most significant interaction between objects at the scale of astronomical bodies, and it determines the motion of satellites, planets, stars, galaxies, and even light.
